intro: Cordemoya grandistipularis, commonly known as the large-stipule cordemoyas, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
